p:
A typical conductivity profile obtained at the detonation of cyclotrimethylene-trinitramine (RDX) is shown in Fig. 1: there is a fast increase to the maximum value σ
max , then a decrease with a gradient dependent on the type of HE, and a slow change with a small value in the Taylor wave after the inflection point. The maximum conductivity σ
max corresponds to the region inside the chemical peak. We relate the inflection point σ
CJ at the conductivity profile σ( t) to the CJ point
34, 35 . We define the duration τ of the high conductivity zone as the time between the beginning of the signal σ( t) and the moment of σ
CJ (the intersection of two approximation straight lines, Fig. 1).
